results.definition: to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means
the act of pressing; the exertion of pressure
examples: he used pressure to stop the bleeding

results.definition: the pressure exerted by the atmosphere
exert pressure on someone through threats
the state of demanding notice or attention
the force applied to a unit area of surface; measured in pascals (SI unit) or in dynes (cgs unit)
examples: the compressed gas exerts an increased pressure

results.definition: the somatic sensation that results from applying force to an area of skin
examples: the sensitivity of his skin to pressure and temperature was normal
the public brought pressure to bear on the government

results.definition: an oppressive condition of physical or mental or social or economic distress
